item.title: The magic tool ffmpeg -- editing video with extreme comfort
item.description: I recently got a new task: I need to split a video of an event into smaller segments of two minutes or less for posting on a short video platform.

item.title: A 30-minute's guide to XGBoost (Python code)
item.description: Xgboost is an integrated learning algorithm, which belongs to the category of boosting algorithms in the 3 commonly used integration methods (bagging, boosting, stacking). It is an additive model, and the base model is usually chosen as a tree model, but other types of models such as logistic regression can also be chosen.

item.title: How to quickly create a REST API with a cluster of asynchronous task queues
item.description: Asynchronous tasks are the most common requirement in web backend development, and are ideal for multitasking and highly concurrent scenarios. This article shares how to use docker-compose, FastAPI, and rq to quickly create a REST API that contains a cluster of asynchronous task queues, and the nodes that execute the tasks on the backend can scale at will.

item.title: Python's fastest way to implement loops (for, while, etc. speed comparison)
item.description: Python is not known to be a very efficient language to execute. In addition, looping is a very time-consuming operation in any language. If any simple single-step operation takes 1 unit of time, repeating the operation tens of thousands of times will eventually increase the time spent tens of thousands of times.

item.title: Python101: 20. Decorators
item.description:
1. Introduction to the concept

decorator, also known as a “decorator function”, is a function that returns a value that is also a function, and can be called a “function of functions”. Its purpose is to implement additional functionality without modifying existing functions. The most basic idea comes from a design pattern called the “decoration pattern”.

item.title: Python101: 17. Functions and Arguments
item.description: Defining a function is very simple, but how to define a function, what parameters are needed, and how to call it is a question we need to think about.

item.title: Python101: 16. Errors and Exceptions
item.description: As a Python beginner, when you first learn Python programming, you will often see error messages, which are the errors and exceptions we’ll talk about next.

item.title: Python101: 15. Set
item.description: Python also contains a set type. A set is an unordered set of non-repeating elements. Its basic usage includes member detection and elimination of duplicate elements. Set objects also support mathematical operations like unions, intersections, difference sets, symmetric differences, and so on.

item.title: Python101: 14. Introduction to Flask for Web Development
item.description: Web development is a must-have skill for programs nowadays, as most software is provided in web form, and you need to understand the concepts and features of web development in order to produce backend development or just frontend development.

item.title: Python101: 12. References
item.description:
1. Introduction of references and tools

The treatment of variables in Python is very different from that of C. Variables in Python have a special property: identity, or “identity”. This special property is also known in many places as a “reference”.

item.description: The dictionary in Python provides a flexible way to access and organize data

item.title: Python101: 10. Classes and Objects
item.description: If you’ve ever learned about object-oriented thinking, you know that object-oriented thinking consists of two basic concepts: classes and objects, and let’s learn more about Python classes and objects.

item.title: Python101: 9. Tuple
item.description: A data structure in Python is a collection of data elements that are organized in some way, and these data elements can be numbers, characters, or even other data structures.

item.title: Python101: 6. Modules and Packages
item.description: Modules and packages are the core of any large program, and even the Python installer itself is a package.

item.title: Python101: 5. Functions
item.description: Functions are organized, reusable segments of code used to implement a single, or associated, function, so I often say that functions are the basis for their use at programmer scale.

item.title: Python101: 4. Flow Control
item.description: In the world of programming, flow control is the foundation on which programmers operate. Flow control determines the way in which programs are executed, and this section gives you an introduction to Python flow control-related syntax.

item.title: Python101: 3. Variables and Data Types
item.description: In this article we will learn about Python variables and data types.

item.title: Python101: 2. Basic Syntax
item.description:
Python is a scripting language.

A scripting language is a special language between HTML and programming languages such as Java, Visual Basic, C++, etc. Although it is closer to the latter, it does not have the complex and rigorous syntax and rules of programming languages. Some scripting languages have evolved, such as Python, and perl can be compiled into intermediate code and then executed, so that they can be called compiled scripting languages.

item.title: Our Privacy Policy

Privacy Policy for QuantMind LLC

At QuantMind, accessible from https://quantmind.ai/, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by QuantMind and how we use it.
